Description: 2001 CORT LARRY CORYELL SIGNATURE LCS-2 HOLLOW BODY JAZZ ELECTRIC GUITAR, ALL MAPLE, CASE As a leading producer of innovative, quality instruments for around 50 years it’s not surprising that Cort has attracted legendary and diverse talents with signature models. These guitarists include Larry Coryell, Matt "Guitar" Murphy, Hiram Bullock, T.M. Stevens and Josh Paul. This Cort Larry Coryell Signature LCS-2 is basically a more affordable version of LCS-1. It has maple back and sides and Duncan designed pickups. That said, this LCS-2 signature model hollow body jazz guitar is in very clean condition, a beauty in its natural all Maple finish, and is a great introduction or backup guitar for a jazz inspired player. It has all the tone you expect from a jazzbox such as this. This guitar comes with a nice hard case. Conveniently lightweight at a bit over 7 pounds, this guitar features Seymour Duncan humbucker pickups and was made in Korea in the 2000s. Again, the Cort Larry Coryell Signature LCS-2 is basically a more affordable version of LCS-1. This 2001 Cort Larry Coryell Signature LCS-2 Hollow Body Jazz Electric Guitar is a used item in close to excellent condition. This guitar shows very little wear with no pick scratches or any issues. There are no dings, marks or concerns with this guitar and it looks as though it may not have been played all the much. The frets are in super shape and the neck is how it should be. The playing on this guitar is super. It sounds cool as an acoustic, too. You will receive this item well-packed inside an unlabeled hard shell case.
